tp:treatment-sec.p:
Sarax huberi
Seiter et al. , 2015: 543–548
, figs 1–3.

Based in part on
Seiter et al . (2015)
, this species may be separated from the geographically closest species,
S. brachydactylus
and
S. curioi
, by the following combination of characters: six setae on anterior margin of carapace without prominent corners (as in
S. curioi
); margin of genital operculum with several setae; female gonopods soft, conical; cheliceral claw with teeth (absent in
S. curioi
); sexual dimorphism in male pedipalps, with femur and tibia elongate; pedipalp surface granular (smooth in
S. brachydactylus
); pedipalp tarsus with two very short, separated dorsal spines (geminate in
S. curioi
).
